Description: The fountain of Pegasus in the gardens of Bomarzo, Viterbo; tall trees and in the centre a circular fountain with a statue of Pegasus on a rocky base, the water descending between rocks in the foreground. 1625 Pen and brown ink, with grey-brown wash
Curator's comments: Lit.: P. Schatborn, 'Drawn to Warmth, 17th-century Dutch artists in Italy', Amsterdam, 2001, pp.68-71, fig.E.
Bibliographic references: Hind 1915-31 / Catalogue of Dutch and Flemish Drawings preserved in the Department of Prints and Drawings in the British Museum (8)
Exhibition history: 1984 Feb-Apr, BM, 'Landscape in Italy', no. 56 2001 June-Sept, Amsterdam, Rijksmuseum, 'Drawn from Warmth...' 2004-2005 Oct-Jan, Birmingham, Barber Inst of Fine Arts, 'Bartolomeus Breenbergh 'Joseph in Egypt'
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: George John Spencer, 2nd Earl Spencer (Lugt 1530; his sale, Thomas Philipe's, London, 10.vi.1811/104 as 'Breenberg (Bartolomeo) One - large Italian landscape at the Villa Bracciana, with a fountain in the middle - a spirited and curious design - masterly pen, bistre, and Indian ink - Bart. Breenbergh f. a Roma 1625' (bt by 'Knight' for £3-3-0))
